intro: Spermacoceodes glabrum var. rectum, commonly known as the common stink bean, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, smooth, black seeds enclosed in a capsule. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it notable for its aromatic properties and medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
